conversation.content: Eight months. I just—I mean, I literally just counted it out on my calendar. [bitter] Eight months of "great exposure" and "invaluable experience" and, um, what exactly do I have to show for it? [pause] So like, yesterday Sarah asked me if I was excited about the new project and I'm thinking, [sarcastic] oh yeah, super excited to work another sixty hours for free while Brad gets promoted to the position they, er, supposedly don't have budget for. [angry] The thing is—God, I'm such an idiot—they kept saying, you know, "just wait until Q3" and then it was "after the merger" and now it's, [mocking] "we're restructuring but you're so valued here." [laugh] Valued! That's—honestly that's hilarious because, uhh, I can't even afford my subway pass anymore. [very sad] My parents keep asking when I'll get a "real job" and I keep defending this place like, [mumbling] oh no, it's actually a great opportunity, I'm learning so much. [furious] Learning what exactly? How to make coffee for people who make six figures? [long pause] The worst part is, I mean, I really believed them. [regretful] Like genuinely thought if I just, hmm, worked hard enough, stayed late enough... [bitter] But there was never a path, was there? [exhausted] They're already interviewing new interns for next semester. Fresh meat. [sigh] And here I am, basically, eight months older, eight months broker, and somehow still hoping they'll—[trailing off] [very quietly] God, what am I doing?

subject: Realizing you've been working as an unpaid intern disguised as a "learning opportunity" for eight months with no path to employment
